programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The fourth seed Cavaliers host the fifth seed Knicks for Game 1 of their Eastern Conference first-round series. Cleveland claimed the first meeting of the season, but New York countered by winning the next three, including 130-116 on March 31.

programme.title: UFC Fight Night: Holloway vs. Allen
programme.desc: Tanner Boser vs. Ion Cutelaba, light heavyweight; Dustin Jacoby vs. Azamat Murzakanov, light heavyweight; Edson Barboza vs. Billy Quarantillo, featherweight; Max Holloway vs. Arnold Allen, featherweight. From T-Mobile Center in Kansas City, Mo.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: XFL Football
programme.desc: From Audi Field in Washington, D.C.

programme.title: XFL Football
programme.desc: From The Dome at America’s Center in Saint Louis, Mo.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Andrew Heaney and the Rangers close the book on a three-game series with the Astros. Heaney (1-1, 8.22 ERA) tied an American League record by striking out nine straight batters in his last start. Houston counters with Framber Valdéz (1-1, 1.89).

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 7 Lakers visit the No. 2 Grizzlies for Game 1 of their Western Conference quarterfinal. LeBron James netted 30 points as Los Angeles rallied from a 15-point second-half deficit to beat Minnesota 108-102 in overtime in the play-in tournament.

programme.title: 2023 Boston Marathon
programme.desc: Coverage from the world's oldest annual marathon.

programme.title: SportsCenter

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: This Just In
programme.desc: The latest news, opinion and analysis on the day's trending and under-the-radar afternoon headlines; a look ahead at the evening's potential news-making moments.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Keyshawn Johnson, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The past two Presidents' Trophy winners clash in Game 1 of a first-round set as Boston hosts Florida. The Bruins' historic regular season saw them set the NHL record for wins (65), points (135), while also tying the league record for road wins (31).

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Kings get a second crack at the Oilers in the first round of the 2023 Stanley Cup playoffs. Edmonton and Los Angeles played all seven games in their opening-round series last year, with Connor McDavid's 14 points helping push Edmonton onwards.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Toronto hosts a formidable and familiar foe in Game 1 of its first-round series versus Tampa Bay. The Lightning ousted the Maple Leafs in seven games during the opening round in 2022, en route to a third consecutive Eastern Conference crown in June.

programme.desc: From the Alamodome in San Antonio.

programme.title: On the Clock
programme.desc: Follow NFL QB prospect Bryce Young through his final college football season and into the offseason as he prepares for the NFL combine, pro day and the NFL draft. NFL legends Archie, Peyton and Eli Manning evaluate and serve as mentors.

programme.title: On the Clock
programme.desc: Follow NFL QB prospect Hendon Hooker through his final college football season and into the offseason as he prepares for the NFL combine, pro day and the NFL draft. NFL legends Archie, Peyton and Eli Manning evaluate and serve as mentors.

programme.title: Player 54: Chasing the XFL Dream
programme.desc: With a coaching staff that includes two Steelers greats, Hines Ward and Joey Porter, the Brahmas try to rally against the Roughnecks. Iconic Rams receiver Ricky Proehl coaches his son Austin as professional football returns to St. Louis.

programme.title: Player 54: Chasing the XFL Dream
programme.desc: Coach Wade Phillips and the Houston Roughnecks bring back a familiar face to offset recent injuries. Tensions rise for coach Terrell Buckley and the winless Orlando Guardians, who host the Seattle Sea Dragons, a team looking to extend its win streak.

programme.title: Player 54: Chasing the XFL Dream
programme.desc: Terrell Buckley and the Orlando Guardians face their toughest test yet when they meet the ruthless D.C. Defenders defense. The Defenders then turn their attention in Week 8 to an intradivision matchup against the surging Seattle Sea Dragons.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 3 seed 76ers host the No. 6 Nets for Game 1 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. The Sixers swept four meetings this season after a 134-105 verdict on April 9. Philadelphia ousted Brooklyn 4-1 in the first round of the 2019 playoffs.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Kings play in the postseason for the first time since 2006 by hosting the Warriors for Game 1 of their Western Conference first-round series. Five-time and defending champion Golden State has won nine of the last 11 meetings dating to 2020-21.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The second-seeded Celtics begin their first-round playoff series against the seventh-seeded Hawks. Boston swept all three meetings with Atlanta this season, but the Hawks were triumphant in six games when they last met in the postseason in 2016.

programme.title: Player 54: Chasing the XFL Dream
programme.desc: Coach Wade Phillips and the Houston Roughnecks bring back a familiar face to offset recent injuries. Tensions rise for coach Terrell Buckley and the winless Orlando Guardians, who host the Seattle Sea Dragons, a team looking to extend its win streak.

programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.desc: Carolina hosts New York in Game 1 of this Eastern first-round quarterfinal. The Islanders return to the postseason following back-to-back trips to the conference finals in 2020 and 2021. Carolina wears a third consecutive Metropolitan Division crown.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: This Just In
programme.desc: The latest news, opinion and analysis on the day's trending and under-the-radar afternoon headlines; a look ahead at the evening's potential news-making moments.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship hockey show featuring highlights, news, analysis, speed, skill and access to the biggest stars, stories and personalities of the game. Hosted by John Buccigross.

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Presenting the latest news from the world of sports.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Xfinity Series completes the Virginia leg of the schedule with the running of the Call811.com Before You Dig 250. Chandler Smith, a 20-year-old phenom with five wins in the Truck Series, scored his first Xfinity Series victory April 1.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Coverage of drag racing action from the National Hot Rod Association.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: From Martinsville Speedway in Martinsville, Va.

programme.title: USFL Football
programme.desc: A matchup of 2022 playoff teams, featuring the defending champion Stallions hosting the Generals. Coach Skip Holtz's Birmingham squad is again led by quarterback J'Mar Smith. From Protective Stadium in Birmingham.

programme.title: USFL Football
programme.desc: The Stars owned the highest-scoring offense in the league last year, led by QB Case Cookus. The Showboats kick off a new season in a new city, having previously been known as the Tampa Bay Bandits. From Simmons Bank Liberty Stadium in Memphis, Tenn.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Seth Lugo tries to remain perfect in a Padres uniform as he faces the Brewers. Lugo allowed two runs over 13 innings in winning his first two starts. Milwaukee sends out Eric Lauer (1-1, 7.71 ERA), who was roughed up by St. Louis in his last turn.

programme.title: NASCAR Xfinity Racing Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Xfinity Series completes the Virginia leg of the schedule with the running of the Call811.com Before You Dig 250. Chandler Smith, a 20-year-old phenom with five wins in the Truck Series, scored his first Xfinity Series victory April 1.

programme.desc: Action from the PBA bowling tour.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay
programme.desc: Behind the scenes and up-to-the minute reports from the garage prior to the start of each NASCAR Cup Series race.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Cup Series moves to Martinsville Speedway for the NOCO 400. William Byron won this race and the adjacent Truck Series event last year. Christopher Bell, who is coming off his first win of 2023, took the last checkered flag in Martinsville.

programme.title: Inside the NBA
programme.desc: This Emmy Award-winning studio show, which airs following each NBA telecast on TNT, is hosted by Ernie Johnson, with analysis from Hall of Famer Charles Barkley and NBA champions Kenny Smith and Shaquille O'Neal. It's a mix of highlights, interviews and hijinks, notably the verbal sparring sessions between the outspoken Barkley and his straight man, Smith. The show also welcomes various guest analysts throughout the season.
